从监视和急救任务到涉及与其他机器或人类合作的工业自动化，无人机的应用正在迅速增加。为了最大限度地扩大区域覆盖范围并减少任务延迟，成群的协作无人机已成为一个重要的研究方向。然而，这种方法需要解决定位、地图绘制和通信方面的公开挑战。这项工作描述了一种基于纳米无人机群的分布式地图系统，其特征是35克的有限有效载荷和严格限制的机载传感和计算能力。每架纳米无人机都配备了四个64像素的深度传感器，可以测量四个方向上与障碍物的相对距离。所提出的系统在不依赖任何外部基础设施的情况下合并来自群的信息并生成连贯的网格图。数据融合使用迭代最接近点算法和基于图形的同时定位和映射算法进行，完全在无人机的低功耗ARM Cortex-M微控制器上运行，只有192kB的SRAM内存。从多达4纳米的无人机群中在三个不同的迷宫中收集的现场结果证明了12厘米的测绘精度，并证明了测绘时间与特工数量成反比。所提出的框架在通信带宽和机载计算复杂度方面呈线性扩展，支持多达20架纳米无人机之间的通信和多达180平方米的区域映射，所选配置只需要50 kB的内存。

Feasibility of Local Trajectory Planning for Level-2+ Semi-autonomous Driving without Absolute Localization
  • EN
  • ZH

Autonomous driving has long grappled with the need for precise absolute localization, making full autonomy elusive and raising the capital entry barriers for startups. This study delves into the feasibility of local trajectory planning for level-2+ (L2+) semi-autonomous vehicles without the dependence on accurate absolute localization. Instead, we emphasize the estimation of the pose change between consecutive planning frames from motion sensors and integration of relative locations of traffic objects to the local planning problem under the ego car's local coordinate system, therefore eliminating the need for an absolute localization. Without the availability of absolute localization for correction, the measurement errors of speed and yaw rate greatly affect the estimation accuracy of the relative pose change between frames. We proved that the feasibility/stability of the continuous planning problem under such motion sensor errors can be guaranteed at certain defined conditions. This was achieved by formulating it as a Lyapunov-stability analysis problem. Moreover, a simulation pipeline was developed to further validate the proposed local planning method. Simulations were conducted at two traffic scenes with different error settings for speed and yaw rate measurements. The results substantiate the proposed framework's functionality even under relatively inferior sensor errors. We also experiment the stability limits of the planned results under abnormally larger motion sensor errors. The results provide a good match to the previous theoretical analysis. Our findings suggested that precise absolute localization may not be the sole path to achieving reliable trajectory planning, eliminating the necessity for high-accuracy dual-antenna GPS as well as the high-fidelity maps for SLAM localization.

自动驾驶长期以来一直在与精确的绝对本地化需求作斗争，这使得完全自主变得难以捉摸，并增加了初创公司的资本进入壁垒。本研究深入探讨了在不依赖精确绝对定位的情况下，对2+（L2+）级半自动驾驶汽车进行局部轨迹规划的可行性。相反，我们强调从运动传感器到交通物体相对位置的连续规划帧之间的姿态变化的估计，以及在ego汽车的局部坐标系下的局部规划问题的集成，从而消除了绝对定位的需要。在没有可用于校正的绝对定位的情况下，速度和偏航率的测量误差极大地影响了帧之间相对姿态变化的估计精度。我们证明了在这种运动传感器误差下的连续规划问题的可行性/稳定性可以在特定的定义条件下得到保证。这是通过将其表述为李雅普诺夫稳定性分析问题来实现的。此外，还开发了一个模拟管道，以进一步验证所提出的局部规划方法。在两个交通场景中进行了模拟，速度和偏航率测量的误差设置不同。即使在相对较差的传感器误差下，结果也证实了所提出的框架的功能。我们还实验了在异常大的运动传感器误差下计划结果的稳定性极限。该结果与之前的理论分析相吻合。我们的研究结果表明，精确的绝对定位可能不是实现可靠轨迹规划的唯一途径，从而消除了高精度双天线GPS以及SLAM定位高保真地图的必要性。

UncLe-SLAM: Uncertainty Learning for Dense Neural SLAM
  • EN
  • ZH

We present an uncertainty learning framework for dense neural simultaneous localization and mapping (SLAM). Estimating pixel-wise uncertainties for the depth input of dense SLAM methods allows re-weighing the tracking and mapping losses towards image regions that contain more suitable information that is more reliable for SLAM. To this end, we propose an online framework for sensor uncertainty estimation that can be trained in a self-supervised manner from only 2D input data. We further discuss the advantages of the uncertainty learning for the case of multi-sensor input. Extensive analysis, experimentation, and ablations show that our proposed modeling paradigm improves both mapping and tracking accuracy and often performs better than alternatives that require ground truth depth or 3D. Our experiments show that we achieve a 38\% and 27\% lower absolute trajectory tracking error (ATE) on the 7-Scenes and TUM-RGBD datasets respectively. On the popular Replica dataset using two types of depth sensors, we report an 11\% F1-score improvement on RGBD SLAM compared to the recent state-of-the-art neural implicit approaches. Source code: https://github.com/kev-in-ta/UncLe-SLAM.

我们提出了一个用于密集神经同时定位和映射（SLAM）的不确定性学习框架。估计密集SLAM方法的深度输入的像素不确定性允许对包含更适合SLAM的信息的图像区域的跟踪和映射损失进行重新加权。为此，我们提出了一种用于传感器不确定性估计的在线框架，该框架可以以自监督的方式仅从2D输入数据中进行训练。我们进一步讨论了不确定性学习在多传感器输入情况下的优势。广泛的分析、实验和消融表明，我们提出的建模范式提高了测绘和跟踪精度，并且通常比需要地面实况深度或3D的替代方案表现更好。我们的实验表明，在7场景和TUM-RGBD数据集上，我们分别实现了38%和27%的绝对轨迹跟踪误差。在使用两种类型的深度传感器的流行副本数据集上，我们报告称，与最近最先进的神经隐式方法相比，RGBD SLAM的F1分数提高了11%。源代码：https://github.com/kev-in-ta/UncLe-SLAM.

tinySLAM-based exploration with a swarm of nano-UAVs
  • EN
  • ZH

This paper concerns SLAM and exploration for a swarm of nano-UAVs. The laser range finder-based tinySLAM algorithm is used to build maps of the environment. The maps are synchronized using an iterative closest point algorithm. The UAVs then explore the map by steering to points selected by a modified dynamic coverage algorithm, for which we prove a stability result. Both algorithms inform each other, allowing the UAVs to map out new areas of the environment and move into them for exploration. Experimental findings using the nano-UAV Crazyflie 2.1 platform are presented. A key challenge is to implement all algorithms on the hardware limited experimental platform.

本文涉及SLAM和纳米无人机群的探索。基于激光测距仪的tinySLAM算法用于绘制环境地图。使用迭代最近点算法对地图进行同步。然后，无人机通过转向由改进的动态覆盖算法选择的点来探索地图，我们证明了其稳定性结果。这两种算法相互通知，使无人机能够绘制出新的环境区域，并进入其中进行探索。介绍了使用纳米无人机Crazyflie 2.1平台的实验结果。一个关键的挑战是在硬件有限的实验平台上实现所有算法。

A Robust Localization Solution for an Uncrewed Ground Vehicle in Unstructured Outdoor GNSS-Denied Environments
  • EN
  • ZH

This work addresses the challenge of developing a localization system for an uncrewed ground vehicle (UGV) operating autonomously in unstructured outdoor Global Navigation Satellite System (GNSS)-denied environments. The goal is to enable accurate mapping and long-range navigation with practical applications in domains such as autonomous construction, military engineering missions, and exploration of non-Earth planets. The proposed system - Terrain-Referenced Assured Engineer Localization System (TRAELS) - integrates pose estimates produced by two complementary terrain referenced navigation (TRN) methods with wheel odometry and inertial measurement unit (IMU) measurements using an Extended Kalman Filter (EKF). Unlike simultaneous localization and mapping (SLAM) systems that require loop closures, the described approach maintains accuracy over long distances and one-way missions without the need to revisit previous positions. Evaluation of TRAELS is performed across a range of environments. In regions where a combination of distinctive geometric and ground surface features are present, the developed TRN methods are leveraged by TRAELS to consistently achieve an absolute trajectory error of less than 3.0 m. The approach is also shown to be capable of recovering from large accumulated drift when traversing feature-sparse areas, which is essential in ensuring robust performance of the system across a wide variety of challenging GNSS-denied environments. Overall, the effectiveness of the system in providing precise localization and mapping capabilities in challenging GNSS-denied environments is demonstrated and an analysis is performed leading to insights for improving TRN approaches for UGVs.

这项工作解决了为在非结构化户外全球导航卫星系统（GNSS）拒绝环境中自主运行的无人地面飞行器（UGV）开发定位系统的挑战。目标是实现精确的地图绘制和远程导航，并在自主建造、军事工程任务和探测非地球行星等领域进行实际应用。所提出的系统——地形参考保证工程师定位系统（TRAELS）——将两种互补地形参考导航（TRN）方法产生的姿态估计与使用扩展卡尔曼滤波器（EKF）的车轮里程计和惯性测量单元（IMU）测量相结合。与需要闭环的同时定位和测绘（SLAM）系统不同，所描述的方法在长距离和单向任务中保持准确性，而不需要重新访问以前的位置。TRAELS的评估是在一系列环境中进行的。在存在独特几何特征和地表特征组合的区域，TRAELS利用所开发的TRN方法始终实现小于3.0 m的绝对轨迹误差。该方法还被证明能够在穿越特征稀疏区域时从大的累积漂移中恢复，这对于确保系统在各种具有挑战性的GNSS拒绝环境中的稳健性能至关重要。总的来说，该系统在具有挑战性的拒绝全球导航卫星系统的环境中提供精确定位和测绘能力的有效性得到了证明，并进行了分析，为改进无人值守地面传感器的TRN方法提供了见解。
